metadata.name: The Ruins of the Temple
metadata.description:
Digital reproduction of a physical artwork

JPG  
3288px x 4657px  
300 dpi

Original physical artwork:  
Charcoal on paper  
150cm x 200cm  
2019

—  
My works are born of pure chance. There are no sketches, models or previous ideas. Just a blank space that breaks up with smudges or unplanned lines of charcoal. When I start to work, I have no clue how it's going to end. I don't even suspect where it's headed. What happens in my drawings is a dialogue between these improvised shapes and the rational responses that arise in front of them.  
In my work I see chaos, I see confinement, I see a dangerous world lurking but I also see refuge, protection. Maybe they are blurred memories, maybe they are dreams, fears or longings. It's probably a bit of all of that. The Why of all that, perhaps, I will find out along the way.  
—

Art by Sergio Figares @circouy
